title: Compact routine containers with scrolling and rename button

requirements.text: Modify the Morning Routine container in MorningRoutine.tsx to have a compact height that displays a maximum of 4 rows of routine items. When more than 4 rows exist, the container should become vertically scrollable while maintaining the compact height limit.

quotes: make Morning Routine and Evening Routine container height more compact for maximum 4 rows of routines, after that it will be scrollable

acceptanceCriteria: Morning Routine container displays maximum 4 rows of routine items at any given time
When routine items exceed 4 rows, vertical scrollbar appears
Container height remains compact and does not expand beyond the 4-row limit
Scrolling is smooth and maintains routine item interaction capabilities

requirements.text: Modify the Evening Routine container in MorningRoutine.tsx to have a compact height that displays a maximum of 4 rows of routine items. When more than 4 rows exist, the container should become vertically scrollable while maintaining the compact height limit.

quotes: make Morning Routine and Evening Routine container height more compact for maximum 4 rows of routines, after that it will be scrollable

acceptanceCriteria: Evening Routine container displays maximum 4 rows of routine items at any given time
When routine items exceed 4 rows, vertical scrollbar appears
Container height remains compact and does not expand beyond the 4-row limit
Scrolling is smooth and maintains routine item interaction capabilities

requirements.text: Change the button label from 'Reset New day' to 'Start New Day' in the component where the new day reset functionality is implemented (likely in TaskManager.tsx or related routine management component).

quotes: Change Reset New day button name to "Start New Day" button

acceptanceCriteria: Button displays 'Start New Day' as its label text
Button styling and placement remain consistent with current design

constraints: Do not modify the routine functionality or drag-and-drop behavior
Maintain existing routine item height and spacing within the scrollable containers
Preserve all existing MorningRoutine.tsx features including display mode toggle and reorder functionality
nonGoals: Changing the routine item card design or layout
Modifying backend routine logic or data structures
Altering routine completion or streak count functionality
Implementing new routine features beyond the specified UI changes
